definition: to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: He had offered the loan of his small villa at Cap Ferrat.
sentences.chinese: 他願意借出在費拉角的小別墅。

sentences.english: When did he return the book to the library?
sentences.chinese: 從圖書館借出來的書都蓋上了歸還的截止日期。

sentences.english: The background picture may be stock footage from a film library.
sentences.chinese: 可以從電影資料館將背景膠片借出。

sentences.english: Possession hinders enjoyment and increase annoyance whethe_r you lend or keep.
sentences.chinese: 佔有總是妨礙享受，徒增煩擾，無論你借出還是廝守。

sentences.english: One cannot borrow books to take away.
sentences.chinese: 借出的書都不能帶出館外。

sentences.english: The Music Office reserves the right to loan the item(s).
sentences.chinese: 音樂事務處保留借出物品的一切權利。

sentences.english: She is chary of lending money.
sentences.chinese: 她對借出金錢很小心謹慎。

sentences.english: I'm sorry about that , we have just run out.
sentences.chinese: 真是抱歉，我們剛好把東西全借出去了。
我既沒把錢借出也沒欠債。

sentences.english: Sorry, the book you want has been checked out.
sentences.chinese: 對不起，你要的這本書已經借出去了。

sentences.english: Clients can lend out their silver or gold at a certain interest rate.
sentences.chinese: 客戶可以在一定借出利率的銀或黃金。

sentences.english: Richmond believes the lending feature will harm authors.
sentences.chinese: 里奇蒙認爲這個“借出”功能將會損害作家的利益。

sentences.english: I'd better push my brother to check out the second one from the library.
sentences.chinese: 我最好催我弟去圖書館把第二集借出來。

sentences.english: The banks can lend only as much money as they possess.
sentences.chinese: 銀行借出去的錢只能和銀行所有的一樣多。

sentences.english: By default only file cache pages are loaned.
sentences.chinese: 在默認情況下，只借出文件緩存頁面。

definition: to lend/to put out a loan
to lend (sth other than money)/to borrow
to provide (an asset) as security for a loan/to put up collateral
excuse me (i.e. let me through, please)
to deposit (e.g. in a bank account)
to demand payment of money owing
